dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 3790 IH: Federal Firearms Licensee Protection Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Russell introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend chapter 44 of title 18, United States Code, to enhance penalties for certain thefts of a firearm from certain Federal firearms licensees, and to criminalize the theft of a firearm from a gun range that rents firearms or a shooting club.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Federal Firearms Licensee Protection Act.

section.header: Amendments to enhance penalties for certain thefts of a firearm from certain Federal firearms licensees
section.text: Section 924 of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (i) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: A person who knowingly violates section 922(u), or attempts to do so, shall be fined under this title, imprisoned not more than 20 years, or both.
In the case of a violation described in subparagraph (A) that occurs during the commission of—

clause.text: a burglary, the term of imprisonment shall be not less than 3 years; or
a robbery, the term of imprisonment shall be not less than 5 years.

subparagraph.text: The term burglary means the unlawful entry into or remaining in the business premises of a licensed importer, licensed manufacturer, or licensed dealer with the intent to commit a crime.
The term robbery has the meaning given that term in section 1951(b)(1) of this title.

paragraph.text: in subsection (m), by inserting , or attempts to do so, after or licensed collector.

section.header: Prohibition on theft of firearm from gun range that rents firearms or shooting club
section.text: Section 922(u) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by adding after and below the end the following:

It shall be unlawful for a person to steal or unlawfully take or carry away from the premises of a gun range at which a firearm may be rented or of a shooting club, any firearm that has been shipped or transported in interstate or foreign commerce.
